chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaiah J Brueggen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: On each count concurrent with same conditions also concurrent.

miscConds.notes: Restitution will be paid under the terms of a payment plan to be established with the agent but calling for no less than 2.5% of gross wages to be paid toward restitution and to be enforced through a wage assignment.

Upon successful completion of all terms and conditions of probation, the record will be expunged under 973.015.
.

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendent in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

  Pay DOC Supervision fees.

  Undergo any other assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by PO to include services for youth that have aged out of foster care and follow through with any treatment recommendations.

Credit to be determined.

supervisions.notes:
WITH CREDIT FOR 365 DAYS - TIME SERVED

ALL RESTITUTION AND COURT COSTS/FEES THAT ARE OUTSTANDING ARE CONVERTED TO A CIVIL JUDGMENT
.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with Vernon Co case 15CF114
.

.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to Ct 1 of this case but Concurrent with sentence in Vernon Co case 15CF114
.

records.addlTxt:
State by Kellis  /  Def NA
CRT:  Def has been absconder for almost 3 weeks.  Def has made no effort to communicate w/ Anne or Emma.  Occassionally we have participants who don't show up to CRT but keep in contact w/ Team - that tells us they want to overcome their struggles.  That is not the case w/ Isaiah.  Facility has also reported def as absconder & other behaviors not becoming of DC participants.  Motion was made to Expel & it was 2nded - it was unanimous.  CRT will accept that - Def is expelled from Drug Crt.

State by Kellis /  Def in person
Per PO Peterson:  Def has a Fail to Pay Warrant through Municipal CRT for Retail Theft ticket
PO Peterson spoke w/ Municipal CRT - Def would need to pay $100 & get pymt plan set up
CRT:  Def to report to jail to pay the $100 toward Municipal CRT Warrant & will go to Municipal CRT in the morning to get payment plan set up
DRG CRT HOLD ORDER - Order that def shall be released from LCJ on 8-2-17 at 8:45 am.  Def is to report directly to DOC, PO Emma Peterson upon release - signed by SLH
